title: Drawing, "Design for Vanity", 1933–34
medium: Graphite, color pencil on tracing paper
inscribed:
Right Margin: Shelf Overall l. 41" H. 36" D. 13"/ 2 Chests L. 14" H. 24" D. 12"
Mirror: 12" x 6.0"
2 Shelves Glass: 13" x 11"
Glass tabler in lower drawers
(paint sketch below)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Vanity consisting of two chests connected by two glass shelves. Top of each shows a small box perhaps for jewelry, an open space with four drawers below.  A tall, narrow mirror rises from the rear center of the vanity.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Vanity", 1933–34.
1933–34. Graphite, color pencil on tracing paper. Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 2003-15-13.
